definitions.definition: To be given , sent , or paid something.
examples: He received many presents for his birthday.

definitions.definition: To take , as something that is offered ; to accept .
examples: He had the offer of employment, but he would not receive it.

definitions.definition: To take goods knowing them to be stolen .
To act as a host for guests ; to give admittance to; to permit to enter , as into one's house , presence , company , etc.
examples: to receive a lodger, visitor, ambassador, messenger, etc.
I received a bloody nose from the collision.

definitions.definition: To allow (a custom , tradition , etc.); to give credence or acceptance to.
To detect a signal from a transmitter .
To be in a position to take possession , or hit back the ball .

subdefinitions.definition: To be in a position to hit back a service .
To be in a position to catch a forward pass .

definitions.definition: To accept into the mind ; to understand .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To be given , sent , or paid something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , dated ) To take , as something that is offered ; to accept .
( law ) To take goods knowing them to be stolen .
( transitive ) To act as a host for guests ; to give admittance to; to permit to enter , as into one's house , presence , company , etc.
To allow (a custom , tradition , etc.); to give credence or acceptance to.
( telecommunications ) To detect a signal from a transmitter .
( sports ) To be in a position to take possession , or hit back the ball .
( transitive , intransitive ) To accept into the mind ; to understand .
